when my brothers came to know that I got

good to make it out to the nuts huh do

suffer from the same four years ago I

Pakistan and met a woman who became one
of my heroes Makar my she had been gang
raped on order of a local tribunal to
punish her family for something her
brother supposedly had done and she used
the compensation money to start schools
so now I've come back to see how she's
doing I carry you if should we fill me
dog Billy will kill what go go but I
mean to me in 2002 when it happened the
government wanted to pay me five hundred
thousand rupees but I said you should
open a school in the year since mukhtar
started the school she's managed to
build a small Empire dedicated defending
women in rural Pakistan they moved our
my women's welfare organization now has
four schools that teach 900 kids plus an
ambulance service a legal clinic a

shelter
much of mukhtars work has been funded by
x readers who flooded moved our with two
hundred ninety thousand dollars in
donations after reading columns about

now has a safe place to live magar even
hired her to teach the first grade
everyday women arrived at the crisis
center seeking help after being attacked
abused kidnapped and worse often by
their own families but these efforts are
beginning to have some effect on local
attitudes there was a woman earlier on
this morning when I arrived who was in

by the police she'd been tortured by her

registering a case against her husband
but they had had them the wit and wisdom

elf has found security at mcdowell tur
she still worries about the fate of her

still living with her brothers who
recently forced her to drop out of
school now shafaq is at risk of being
sold off as well if we were to drive to
your village then do you think suppose
we want to leave or not situations like
these are agonizing for me as a
journalist I'm more comfortable
observing but to think of a 14 year old
girl being sold off into a brothel by
her family that makes you want to try to
help the missa but we found a way
through a trusted intermediary to get
shafaq on the phone an offer to come get
her and bring her to MOOC garish shelter
shafaq was too scared to accept our
offer she feared that if her brother's
caught her they would kill her but
Mukhtar and her people plan to go get
her if she ever changes her mind so let
me offer a Thanksgiving toast let's give
thanks for the courage of women like
McGowan sajida and to the generosity of
readers who are supporting them because
they had the faith to send checks to an
illiterate rape victim in a remote
Pakistani village here's to you in
Pakistan
the new york times i'm nicholas kristof
